speaker: Doctor
text: What symptoms are you experiencing with your skin lesions? Are they itchy, painful, or changing in appearance?

speaker: Patient
text: The lesions are painless and have not changed in appearance. They are red and crusty, but they don't itch at all.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any new lesions appearing, or have any of the existing lesions been present for a long time?

speaker: Patient
text: The existing lesions have been present for quite some time and haven't changed. I haven't noticed any new lesions appearing recently.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any previous skin conditions or a history of sun exposure or sunburns?

speaker: Patient
text: I have a history of eczema, but previous treatments for it haven't worked. I haven't had significant sun exposure or sunburns that I can recall.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any other symptoms, such as fever, weight loss, or fatigue, alongside the skin lesions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any fever, weight loss, or fatigue. I feel generally well aside from the skin lesions.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your medications or started any new treatments for your skin condition?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't started any new medications or treatments since arriving in the US. The treatments I tried back home for syphilis and eczema didn't help at all.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the texture of the lesions, such as scaling or bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: The lesions have a crusty texture, but they haven't bled or scaled. They remain consistent in appearance without any significant changes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of skin cancer or other dermatological conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any known family history of skin cancer or hereditary dermatological conditions. My family has generally been healthy.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you traveled to any areas with a high prevalence of skin infections or diseases, or have you had any recent insect bites or exposure to irritants?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled to any areas known for skin infections recently, and I haven't had any insect bites or exposure to irritants that I can think of. My environment has been pretty stable since I arrived here.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the color of the lesions, such as darkening or becoming more red? Additionally, how many lesions do you currently have?

speaker: Patient
text: The lesions remain red and haven't darkened or changed color. I currently have two lesions, one on my penis and one on my left middle finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any pain or discomfort in the areas where the lesions are located, particularly around the genital area or finger?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any pain or discomfort in the areas where the lesions are located. They feel completely normal to me, aside from their appearance.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent sexual activity, and if so, have you noticed any changes in your partner's skin or health?

speaker: Patient
text: I have had recent sexual activity, but I haven't noticed any changes in my partner's skin or health. Everything seems normal on their end.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any sexually transmitted infections in the past, and if so, how were they treated?

speaker: Patient
text: I have a history of syphilis, but the treatments I received back home didn't seem to work. I haven't had any other sexually transmitted infections that I know of.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any other symptoms in the genital area, such as discharge or unusual odor? Additionally, how long have the lesions been present?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any discharge or unusual odor in the genital area. The lesions have been present for several months now.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent skin biopsies or dermatological evaluations done on the lesions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any skin biopsies or dermatological evaluations done since I arrived in the US. I was hoping to get evaluated here at the clinic.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your overall health, such as new allergies or sensitivities to products like soaps or lotions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any changes in my overall health or developed any new allergies or sensitivities to products. I use the same soaps and lotions as before without any issues.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any other skin changes elsewhere on your body, such as rashes or lesions in different areas? Additionally, do you have any history of HPV or warts?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any rashes or lesions in other areas of my body; the only lesions I have are on my penis and finger. I don't have a history of HPV or warts either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any vaccinations for HPV, and do you have any history of skin cancer or precancerous lesions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any vaccinations for HPV, and I don't have any history of skin cancer or precancerous lesions. My family has generally been healthy in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the size of the lesions, or have they remained consistent in size since you first noticed them?

speaker: Patient
text: The lesions have remained consistent in size since I first noticed them. They haven't grown or shrunk at all.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had a skin biopsy or any imaging done on these lesions in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any skin biopsies or imaging done on these lesions in the past. I was hoping to get a thorough evaluation here at the clinic.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Skin_Biopsy

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Cells with nuclear hyperchromasia, multinucleation, and increased mitotic figures within the follicle-bearing epithelium.

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: Doctor: Based on your symptoms and the examination findings, we may need to consider a biopsy to get a clearer understanding of the lesions. Are you comfortable with that? Patient: Yes, I'm open to a biopsy if it will help determine what's going on with my skin lesions.
